meanings.definition: The ability to speak, write, or understand multiple languages.
meanings.sent1: Her impressive polyglotisms allowed her to effortlessly switch between languages during the conference.
meanings.sent2: In the diverse city, polyglotisms were common as people conversed in various languages on the streets.
meanings.sent3: The polyglotisms of the parrot amazed everyone at the zoo, as it mimicked different languages with ease.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a treasure trove of polyglotisms, each language a key to a different world.
meanings.sent5: The polyglotisms of the diplomat made him a valuable asset in international negotiations.

meanings.definition: The practice of using multiple languages in a single conversation or text.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the actors showcased their polyglotisms by seamlessly switching between languages on stage.
meanings.sent2: In the bustling market, polyglotisms filled the air as vendors interacted with customers from various countries.
meanings.sent3: The polyglotisms of the menu confused the tourists, who struggled to understand the different language sections.
meanings.sent4: Her poetry was a beautiful tapestry of polyglotisms, weaving together words from different languages.
meanings.sent5: The polyglotisms of the conference highlighted the importance of language diversity in global communication.
